In many faith traditions, prayer is seen as a powerful tool for healing, community-building, and reflection, and it can be an effective way to bring people together around a common cause. During services related to social justice or other similar issues, a reverend may lead the congregation in prayers of gratitude, hope, and solidarity, and ask for the strength and wisdom to create positive change in the world.

Prayer can help create a sense of unity and shared purpose among those attending the service, and it can be a powerful reminder that they are not alone in their desire to make a difference in the world. Additionally, prayer can provide a space for individuals to process feelings of grief, anger, or frustration related to social injustices, and offer petitions for support or guidance in how to actively address such issues. 

Overall, prayer can be an important part of a reverend's efforts to address social issues and bring about positive change in their community.
